inventory.commentary: Merged groups 1 and 3, modified examples, added commentary. ahouston

sense.name: an ongoing process of rivalry
sense.commentary: COMPETITION[+activity][+ongoing][+rivalry] An ongoing activity of rivalry between opposing forces, e.g., businesses, organisms, ideas, teams
sense.examples: In a capitalist society, competition leads to improved quality and lower costs. Business competition can be fiendish at times. A spirit of competition motivated the employees. Natural selection involves competition among organisms for available resources. John's love for Mary led to bitter competition with Jack. The teams were in fierce competition for first place. The two political parties were in competition for the hearts and minds of the voters.

sense.name: a contest, a specific event
sense.examples: We held a hot-dog eating competition, and I won! Mary is skating in three competitions at the nationals. The competition ended in a dead heat. Jane's dog won second prize in the large breed competition.

sense.name: rival or group of rivals
sense.commentary: COMPETITION[+entity][+contestant][+person/+group] The people who compete, either a group or an individual Note: whether a group or individual, occurs naturally in the singular
sense.examples: He wanted to know what the competition was doing. John never had respect for his competition. Your competition in today's race will be Quickness Racer and Velocity Racer.
